page.title: 18Trees in Mortimer
page.content: In 1976 a field near the railway station was converted into a copse with 19{balsam poplars;}there are also six{ash}and six{maple}along the new road fencing planted 1977-78. Since then determined efforts have been made to establish trees in the fairground area, and around the two ponds. In spite of vandalism, drought and poor soil, 70 trees now flourish, including{chestnut, willow, maple, {ash}with some thirty trees planted in the early seventies.{Tree "clippings" {from the village:-}Mortimer play group celebrated its 21st birthday this year by planting a willow tree and wild flowers around the village pond. St. John's has been awarded a disease- resistant{elm}tree, to be planted in September. Children counted 42{oak trees along Victoria Road, many with posters on.
